required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial of Surufatinib Combined With JS001 in the Treatment of Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Trial Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Efficacy of Surufatinib Combined With JS001 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, phase I study evaluating safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and efficacy of Surufatinib combined with the humanized anti-PD-1 antibody JS001 in patients with solid tumors.

primary_outcome.description: Safety of participants followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 1 week
tolerability during the treatment of first cycle

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The number of cases in which tumor size is reduced to PR or CR / the total number of evaluable cases (%). In the event of PR or CR, the subjects should confirm it no less than 4 weeks after the first evaluation. CT/MRI will be performed every 2 cycles of treatment by RECIST 1.1(each cycle is 21 days))
From date of enrollment until the date of tumor progression
Pharmacokinetic profile in terms of observed maximum plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinity (AUC(0-inf))
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic profile in terms of plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinity, AUC(0-inf)

arm_group.description: Surufatinib at a dose of 200mg Qd, with humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody（JS001） injected intravenously 240mg per 3 weeks until disease progresses or unacceptable tolerability occurs.
Surufatinib at a dose of 300mg Qd, with humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody（JS001) injected intravenously 240mg per 3 weeks until disease progresses or unacceptable tolerability occurs.

intervention.description: humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody(JS001) is a programmed death-1 (PD-1) immune checkpoint inhibitor antibody, which selectively interferes with th combination of PD-1 with its ligands, PD-L1 and PD-L2, resulting in the activitation of lymphocytes and elimination of malignancy theoretically.

responsible_party.investigator_title: MD, Professor, Chief of Department of GI Oncology, Peking University Cancer Hospital
